items.title: These are the most active investors in Hong Kong’s startups
items.summary:
- The article discusses the most active investors in Hong Kong's startups over the past 12 months.
- It features firms that have invested in three or more Hong Kong-based companies in the specified timeframe.
- The data is continually updated, and details can be submitted for corrections via email.

items.title: Indian laundry startup Quick Clean nets $6m in funding
items.summary:
- Quick Clean secures ₹52 crore (US$6 million) in its first funding round.
- Investment co-led by Alkemi Growth Capital and Blue Ashva Capital, with an additional ₹10 crore (US$1.1 million) in debt.
- Founded in 2010, Quick Clean provides laundry solutions to hospitals and hotels across 35+ cities in India, serving clients like Taj and Marriott.
- Partners with global brands like LG and Electrolux for advanced laundry solutions.

items.title: AI firm Bridgetown Research secures $19m series A
items.author: Harsh Sahai
items.summary:
- Bridgetown Research raised US$19 million in a series A funding round.
- The funding round was led by Lightspeed Venture Partners and Accel, with participation from a research university.
- This funding values the Seattle-based startup at US$250 million.
- Bridgetown Research develops AI agents to collect proprietary data from expert input and customer surveys.
- The startup plans to enhance its AI agents' analytical capabilities with the new funding.

items.title: UK’s organ-preservation tech firm OrganOx raises $142m
items.summary:
- OrganOx raised US$142 million in a funding round led by HealthQuest Capital.
- The company has developed a technology that extends liver preservation time to up to 24 hours, nearly double that of traditional methods.
- OrganOx's platform has been used in over 5,000 liver transplants worldwide and aims to explore kidney transplant applications in the future.

items.title: The 50 top-funded AI startups in Asia
items.summary:
- The article lists AI companies in Asia with the highest funding.
- Data is based on Tech in Asia’s research, focusing on companies that raised money in the past two years.
- The list aims to identify companies likely to have a global impact based on their funding levels.

items.title: Xiaomi founder Lei Jun now China’s richest
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Xiaomi’s founder and CEO Lei Jun is now the richest person in China with estimated wealth of 440 billion yuan (around US$60.6 billion).
- His wealth largely comes from a 24.2% stake in Xiaomi, valued at approximately 341.2 billion yuan (around US$46.99 billion).
- Xiaomi's shares rose nearly 6%, pushing the company's market value over HK$1.4 trillion (about US$180 billion) and setting a record high stock price of HK$56.8 (around US$7.3).
- Since October 2022, Xiaomi's stock has increased by over 570% from a low of HK$8.31 (around US$1.07).
- Analysts remain optimistic about Xiaomi's prospects, with Goldman Sachs raising its price target for the company's stock from HK$38 (around US$4.89) to HK$58 (around US$7.46).

items.title: PH fintech Maya achieved profitability in 2024
items.summary:
- Maya, a leading digital banking platform in the Philippines, reported significant growth and is on track to achieve profitability by December 2024.
- The customer base reached 5.4 million, a 71% increase year-on-year, with loans nearly doubling to 1.6 million borrowers.
- Deposits grew to 39 billion peso (US$673.4 million), marking a 59% year-on-year increase, while cumulative loan disbursements totaled 92 billion peso (US$1.6 billion).

items.title: Uber launches private car ride-sharing service in India
items.summary:
- Uber launches a ride-sharing service in Assam, India, allowing private car owners to become drivers.
- This is Uber's first initiative in India to allow vehicles with white number plates to operate as taxis.
- The initial rollout will feature women and army veterans as drivers to promote inclusivity.
- The pilot project aims to encourage other Indian states to permit private vehicles for shared rides.
- The model faces challenges and resistance from unions in India, which is new compared to the US and UK.

items.title: Ex-Twitter CEO’s VC firm seeks $400m for fifth fund
items.author: Evan Williams
items.summary:
- Obvious Ventures, co-founded by Evan Williams, is seeking to raise $400 million for its fifth fund.
- This fund comes after a previous fundraising of $355 million in 2022, which was short of its $400 million target.
- The firm, established in 2014, has invested in companies like Beyond Meat and focuses on planetary health, human health, and economic health.

items.title: India’s upGrad launches $11.45m AI incubator for startups
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based edtech firm upGrad has launched the ‘upGrad AI Incubator’ with an investment of 100 crore rupees (US$11.45 million) to support 5-6 AI startups.
- The incubator will provide infrastructure and seed funding to promote innovation.
- UpGrad's first investment goes to Bengaluru-based startup ZuAI, with undisclosed financial terms.
- UpGrad is partnering with Maharashtra’s government to establish AI excellence centers with a planned investment of 2,150 crore rupees (US$246.73 million).
- Founded in 2015, upGrad offers online and hybrid skilling programs, collaborating with global universities.

items.title: Chipmaker firm Onsemi to cut 2,400 jobs by 2025
items.summary:
- Onsemi plans to eliminate approximately 2,400 jobs by 2025 as part of a global restructuring plan.
- The decision was announced in a company filing on February 25, aimed at reducing operational costs.
- The restructuring is expected to cost between US$50 million and US$60 million, mainly recorded within this fiscal year.
- Annual savings from this plan are anticipated to be between US$105 million and US$115 million.

items.title: Indian court fines Amazon $38.9m for trademark violation
items.summary:
- The Delhi High Court fined Amazon 339.3 crore rupees (US$38.89 million) for trademark infringement concerning the Beverly Hills Polo Club (BHPC) logo.
- The penalty includes 292.7 crore rupees for lost royalties, 43.33 crore rupees for increased advertising costs, and 3.23 crore rupees in additional fees.
- The court previously instructed Amazon to remove infringing products within 72 hours and a similar ruling was made by the UK Supreme Court in March 2024.

items.title: US maternity startup Millie nets $12m series A
items.author: Anu Sharma
items.summary:
- Millie, a maternity clinic in California, has raised $12 million in its series A funding round.
- The investment was led by RH Capital, TMV, and Pivotal Ventures, founded by Melinda French Gates.
- Established by Anu Sharma in 2019, Millie launched in 2022, providing maternity and gynecology services, including mental health support.
- The clinic offers a combination of in-person and virtual care, along with a tech platform for patient monitoring, and collaborates with major insurance providers.
- Millie aims to expand its services across California and improve its technology offerings, having raised nearly $19 million in total funding.

items.title: Chip design software firm Synopsys forecasts $1.62b Q2 revenue
items.summary:
- Synopsys projects Q2 2025 revenue between US$1.59 billion and US$1.62 billion, surpassing Wall Street estimates.
- Midpoint forecast slightly exceeds analysts' expectations of US$1.60 billion.
- Anticipated earnings per share are between US$3.37 and US$3.42, above predictions of US$3.35.
- Following the forecast, Synopsys shares rose by 2.45% to US$482 in after-hours trading.
- Increased demand driven by companies like Amazon, Google, and Apple for proprietary chip development.
- Growth in AI chip development noted as a contributing factor by CEO Sassine Ghazi.

items.title: Google cuts staff in cloud division as AI investment grows
items.summary:
- Google has laid off fewer than 100 employees in its cloud division, primarily in sales operations.
- The layoffs are part of strategic adjustments to focus on AI and meet customer demands for long-term growth.
- This decision follows slow growth in Google Cloud's earnings and the tech industry's trend of layoffs while balancing AI investments with profitability.

items.title: Snowflake expands AI push, forecasts 24% of revenue growth
items.summary:
- Snowflake Inc. expects a 24% increase in product revenue for FY ending January 2026, reaching $4.28 billion, surpassing analysts’ estimates of $4.23 billion.
- In Q4, product revenue grew 28% to $943.3 million, exceeding expected $915.8 million; customers spending over $1 million annually rose to 580.
- The company is expanding AI capabilities, integrating models from OpenAI and Anthropic, according to CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy.
- Remaining performance obligations hit $6.9 billion, higher than the $6.67 billion estimate.
- Shares rose 9% in after-hours trading following a close of $166.19 that day.

items.title: Instagram considers separate Reels app
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Instagram is contemplating a standalone app for its short-form video feature, Reels.
- Internal meetings regarding this were led by Adam Mosseri, head of Instagram.
- The move aims to attract users amid uncertainty surrounding TikTok’s future in the U.S.
- The potential app intends to replicate TikTok’s video-scrolling experience.

items.title: SG quantum computing firm explores $500m public merger
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Horizon Quantum Computing and dMY Squared Technology Group have signed a non-binding letter of intent to explore a potential merger.
- The merger aims to create a publicly listed company led by CEO Joe Fitzsimons.
- The LOI values Horizon Quantum at $500 million pre-money, with a target to finalize a definitive agreement by Q2 2025 and close the transaction by year-end.
- The merger is subject to due diligence, board and shareholder approvals, and regulatory clearances.
- Horizon Quantum develops advanced software tools for quantum computing, including a quantum operating system for practical applications.

items.title: Indian cross border fintech startup nets $2m seed funding
items.author: Dewang Neralla, Geeta Chauhan, Ujwal Tamminedi
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based payments platform HiWiPay raises US$2 million in seed funding led by Unicorn India Ventures.
- Funding will be used to expand trade remittance services and operations in education remittance sector.
- HiWiPay aims for US$100 million in transaction volume in the next 12 to 18 months.
- Partnership with over 500 education consultants to onboard 5,000 international students in 18 months.
- Plans to launch a student app in the UK and enter the SME trade remittance market.

items.title: Kredivo takes over GajiGesa in $12m deal: source
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Kredivo has acquired Indonesian earned-wage access startup GajiGesa for approximately $12 million.
- GajiGesa will continue to operate as a separate brand within Kredivo Group.
- Discussions regarding the acquisition began in March 2024 when GajiGesa sought a partnership for its salary disbursements.
- GajiGesa, founded in 2020, now serves over 350,000 employees across 400 enterprises, helping them access wages early.
- The startup has raised $9.1 million in funding from investors like MassMutual Ventures and Wagestream.

items.title: Toyota completes first phase of futuristic ‘Woven City’
items.summary:
- Toyota has completed the first phase of its ‘Woven City,’ a prototype urban area in Japan designed for advanced technology integration.
- The city spans over 700,000 square meters and features dedicated roads for autonomous vehicles, multiple transportation modes, and pedestrian pathways.
- Construction started in 2021, with plans for logistics via an underground passageway and safety evaluations for various modes of transport.
- Approximately 360 residents, including employees and families, are expected to move in later this year, with an eventual population target of around 2,000 residents.

items.title: Zepto expands dark stores, opens first women-only outlet
items.summary:
- Zepto has expanded in India with over 20 dark stores located in Coimbatore, Tiruchirappalli, Madurai, Vellore, and Salem.
- Launched its first women-only dark store, strategically placed within 2-3 km for quick delivery at speeds of 15-20 km/h.
- Partnered with 100+ local farmers for sourcing regional products like tender coconuts and green vegetables.
- Offers various regional products alongside national and global brands.
- Competition in quick commerce is increasing with rivals like Blinkit and Swiggy Instamart expanding their operations.

items.title: Vietnam-based agritech firm Techcoop secures $70m series A
items.summary:
- Techcoop announced a $70 million series A funding round on Feb. 24.
- Funding consists of $28 million in equity and $42 million in debt financing.
- Co-led by TNB Aura and AVV, with participation from BlueOrchard, FMO, AppWorks, and Capria Ventures.
- Investment aimed at enhancing Techcoop’s digital platform and export infrastructure for crops like cashew nuts, coconut, and coffee.
- The company intends to expand technology and improve sustainable farming practices.
- Techcoop has been profitable since its launch in 2022 and targets $130 million in annual revenue by the end of 2024.

items.title: Spotify CEO criticizes Apple over EU compliance failures
items.author: Daniel Ek
items.summary:
- Spotify CEO Daniel Ek accuses Apple of failing to comply with the EU’s Digital Markets Act (DMA), calling it a “farce.”
- Criticism directed at Apple for a “pattern of delaying and stalling” during a meeting with European Commission officials.
- DMA could impose fines of up to 10% of a company’s global revenue for non-compliance, with a decision on Apple's compliance expected by the end of March.
- Ek notes that Apple’s plans for alternative app stores still impose harmful fees on developers.
- The EU fined Apple €1.8 billion over restrictive App Store practices, and investigations are ongoing.
- US President Donald Trump has threatened retaliatory tariffs against the EU over the fines.

items.title: Indonesia agrees to lift iPhone 16 ban after $1b deal
items.summary:
- Indonesia lifts the five-month ban on the iPhone 16 following a deal with Apple.
- The ban, which began in October 2024, was due to Apple not meeting domestic manufacturing requirements.
- Apple will invest $1 billion in Indonesia, up from a previous investment of $95 million.
- This investment supports Indonesia's goals for local manufacturing and foreign investment.
- The market in Indonesia includes over 278 million people, many of whom are tech-savvy.
- The decision comes as Apple seeks to expand in Southeast Asia amid slower sales growth in China.

items.title: Indian IT firm Wipro to invest $200m in venture arm
items.summary:
- Wipro Limited announces a new investment of US$200 million for its venture arm, Wipro Ventures.
- This marks the fourth funding round since Wipro Ventures was established in 2015.
- Wipro Ventures targets early-to mid-stage startups focusing on AI, data analytics, cybersecurity, and cloud infrastructure.
- The firm has invested in 37 startups over the past decade, achieving 12 successful exits.
- The new funding is intended to enhance collaboration with innovative startups and improve services for enterprise clients.

items.title: China rejects 63 trademark applications for DeepSeek
items.summary:
- China’s National Intellectual Property Administration (CNIPA) rejected 63 trademark applications for the name “DeepSeek.”
- The applications were deemed attempts to exploit the attention towards the Hangzhou-based AI firm’s models.
- DeepSeek is recognized for its large language models, noted for performance and cost efficiency, and continues to face trademark disputes amid its open-source research releases.

items.title: Baidu’s streaming platform launches DeepSeek-powered chatbot
items.summary:
- YY Live, a Chinese live-streaming platform owned by Baidu, has launched an AI-powered chatbot called YYDS.
- YYDS is built on DeepSeek’s V3 foundation and R1 reasoning models, available on mobile and desktop.
- The chatbot's name is derived from a popular meme expressing admiration, indicating the trend of AI in the industry.
- This launch follows Baidu's acquisition of YY Live for U$2.1 billion, lower than the original U$3.6 billion deal.
- Baidu plans to invest US$1.6 billion from the acquisition into cloud and AI infrastructure.
- This move aims to strengthen Baidu's position in China's live-streaming and short-video market, competing with ByteDance’s Douyin, Kuaishou, and Alibaba.

items.title: Indian EV financing startup Vidyut bags $2.5m
items.summary:
- Indian electric vehicle financing startup Vidyut has successfully raised $2.5 million in funding.
- The funding is aimed at expanding its services and operations within the EV sector.
- This financial boost highlights the growing interest in financing solutions for electric vehicles in India.

items.title: Polish AI robotics startup Nomagic raises $44m series B
items.summary:
- Polish robotics startup Nomagic raised US$44 million in a series B funding round.
- The funding aims to expand its market presence beyond Europe into North America.
- The company focuses on AI-driven robotic arms for logistics, planning to enhance technology and business development.
- Funding round led by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), with participation from existing investors like Khosla Ventures and Almaz Capital, and venture debt from the European Investment Bank (EIB).

items.title: DeepSeek offers 75% discounts during off-peak hours
items.summary:
- DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, introduced off-peak pricing for its AI models.
- Discounts of up to 75% for API usage from 16.30 GMT to 00.30 GMT announced on Feb. 26.
- R1 model API will see a 75% discount, V3 model API will have a 50% discount during the specified times.
- Off-peak hours correspond with standard daytime hours in Europe and the US.
- Recent developments include reopening API access after a suspension and launching new AI solutions.

items.title: Huawei to launch first HarmonyOS Next smartphone in March
items.summary:
- Huawei is set to launch a smartphone in March featuring the HarmonyOS Next platform.
- This is the first device developed specifically for the HarmonyOS Next ecosystem, according to Richard Yu Chengdong.
- Major Chinese tech companies are adapting their applications for compatibility with HarmonyOS Next.
- The announcement was made in a video released on Feb. 24, showcasing advancements in hardware and software.

items.title: Nvidia revenue hits record $130.5b on AI growth in FY 2025
items.summary:
- Nvidia reported Q4 revenue of US$39.3 billion, a 12% increase from the previous quarter and 78% from last year.
- For FY 2025, Nvidia's total revenue reached US$130.5 billion, marking a 114% year-on-year increase.
- GAAP earnings per share rose to US$2.94, representing a 147% increase.
- Data Center revenue hit US$35.6 billion in the quarter, a 16% quarter-over-quarter rise and 93% year-on-year growth, driven by AI technology adoption.
- Several significant developments in February 2025 include competition from DeepSeek and major investments and exits in Nvidia's portfolio.

items.title: Amazon unveils genAI-powered Alexa voice assistant
items.summary:
- Amazon to announce new updates for Alexa on February 27, integrating generative AI for more conversational interaction.
- The internal project named "Banyan" aims to enhance Alexa's functionality, allowing it to process multiple prompts and take actions without direct commands.
- The upgraded version will be available to a limited number of users in the coming weeks and months.

items.title: How Thailand’s big banks shape – and stifle – fintech innovation
items.summary:
- Thailand’s fintech sector lacks unicorns and foreign VC firms, affecting startup growth.
- Chonladet Khemarattana, CEO of the Thai Fintech Association, highlights the corporate venture capital dominance.
- Local fintech firms often cater to banks, limiting their independence and scalability.
- The country’s six largest banks control 82% of loans and deposits, creating a non-competitive environment.
- Three new virtual banking licenses are expected, but big banks lead the contenders.

items.title: Singaporean chip tool maker eyes AI after stock drop
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- ASMPT reported a 94.4% drop in net profit for Q4 2024, totaling HK$4.2 million (US$537,000).
- Revenue remained steady at HK$3.4 billion (US$434 million).
- On Feb. 26, ASMPT’s stock price fell 16.6%, closing at HK$64 (US$8.23).
- CEO Robin Ng cited challenges in non-AI sectors due to a sluggish global economy.
- ASMPT is shifting focus to AI applications to meet the growing demand for AI chips and infrastructure.

items.title: AI component demand drives Taiwan’s industrial growth
items.summary:
- Taiwan's industrial production grew by 5.07% year-on-year in January, fueled by demand for AI electronic components.
- The electronics sector's output surged by 16.67%, with integrated circuits (IC) increasing by 22.92%, reaching a record high.
- Growth attributed to sustained demand from US tech firms for essential AI and high-performance computing chips.
- Non-tech sectors faced declines in basic metals, chemicals, and machinery equipment production.
- The Ministry of Economic Affairs anticipates continued support for the tech sector from AI-driven demand.

items.title: AI education lender Lorien Finance raises $2.25m pre-series A
items.author: Nikhil Mudgal
items.summary:
- Lorien Finance has raised US$2.25 million in a pre-series A funding round.
- Funding led by FlatIronX, with participation from Seedstars International Ventures, Ahimsa Capital, Play Holdings, and others.
- Created a US$3 billion lending pool with over 17 international lenders, interest rates starting at 3.49%.
- Processed funding applications for more than 1,000 students in India since its launch.
- Funding will help expand services to Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities in India, improving access to financing.

items.title: Southeast Asian startups that raised funds over 18 months ago
items.summary:
- Startups with at least 18 months of runway are analyzed for their fundraising history.
- Those listed did their last fundraising round between 18 months and three years ago.
- Scenarios include thriving businesses, reduced burn rates, unannounced funding, or fundraising challenges.
- Listing does not imply the business's current status; it simply reflects the timeframe since the last funding.

items.title: Israeli revenue management platform nets $7m seed
items.author: Erez Agmon, Shenhav Avidar, Shai Gross
items.summary:
- Tel Aviv-based revenue management platform Vayu raised US$7 million in seed funding.
- Investment co-led by Flint Capital and The Garage, with participation from Fresh.Fund and others.
- Funding aims to develop Vayu's platform and expand global market presence.
- Vayu assists B2B companies with complex hybrid pricing models via a no-code automation solution.
- The company processes large-scale data for precise billing.

items.title: South Korean province signs $35b AI data center deal
items.author: Kim Yung-Rok
items.summary:
- Governor Kim Yung-Rok of Jeollanam-do Province signed a US$35 billion AI data center agreement with Fir Hills Inc.
- The agreement was signed in Santa Clara, California, involving collaboration with the local government and landowner.
- Construction is scheduled to begin in winter 2025, with an expected job creation of 10,000 positions in the province.

items.title: Shein threads carefully in Indian return
items.summary:
- Fast-fashion giant Shein has returned to India through a partnership with Reliance Retail, after being banned in 2020 due to data security issues.
- Shein must navigate strong competition from established players like Myntra and Zudio, which already have entrenched supply chains in the country.
- The firm plans to also relocate parts of its supply chain into India, looking to integrate more local manufacturing.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Israel’s startups
items.summary:
- The article discusses the most active investors in Israel's startups over the past year.
- The list is generated based on data highlighting firms that have invested in at least three companies in Israel within the last 12 months.
- The data is constantly updated, aiming to reflect the impact of each firm better as well as the number of deals made by early-stage investors.
- For more detailed information or corrections, readers are encouraged to contact the source.

items.title: AI Pioneer Schmidhuber Supports Saudi Investments
items.author: Jürgen Schmidhuber
items.summary:
- Jürgen Schmidhuber supports Saudi Arabia's AI investments as part of Vision 2030 initiatives.
- He believes these investments are vital for advancing global AI capabilities.
- Schmidhuber acknowledges Saudi Arabia's efforts to establish itself as a tech hub amidst U.S. and Chinese competition.
- He is known for his contributions to deep learning and co-founded the AI startup Nnaisense in 2014.
- Schmidhuber states that AI can address real-world challenges like healthcare and robotics, avoiding dystopian concerns.
- He predicts that smaller, cost-effective AI systems will democratize technology and lessen dependence on large data centers.

items.title: SG’s first laser communication mission to launch in 2026
items.summary:
- Transcelestial to demonstrate Singapore’s first inter-satellite laser communication mission.
- Project supported by the Office for Space Technology and Industry (OSTIn) and ST Engineering.
- High-speed data transfer between satellites using Transcelestial’s laser communication terminals.
- ST Engineering Satellite Systems as the main contractor for satellite design and manufacturing.
- Mission aims for inter-satellite data exchange in Low Earth Orbit by 2026.
- Collaboration to enhance space connectivity and Singapore’s role in the space sector.

items.title: Carousell participates in OpenAI’s Operator preview for AI
items.summary:
- Carousell Group joins OpenAI’s research preview for Operator, an AI agent focused on web-based tasks.
- The initiative aims to enhance user experience for secondhand item transactions.
- Collaboration is in early stages; no specifics on implementation or timeline have been disclosed.
- Carousell has previously utilized AI for personalized recommendations and moderation.

items.title: China criticizes Taiwan for moving chip industry to US
items.summary:
- China accuses Taiwan of transferring its semiconductor industry to the US.
- The claim follows reports about Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) possibly investing in Intel.
- TSMC has not commented on the discussions despite being a major supplier for companies like Apple and Nvidia.

items.title: UK media oppose AI firms using content without license, fee
items.summary:
- British national newspapers published identical front pages on Feb. 25 for the #MakeItFair campaign.
- The initiative addresses proposed changes to copyright laws that may allow AI companies to use creative content without permission or compensation.
- The campaign includes major stakeholders from the creative industry and aligns with the UK government's consultation on copyright law changes.
- Proposed draft would let tech companies use copyrighted materials for training AI unless creators opt out.
- The campaign argues that the changes would favor large tech firms over the creative sectors.

items.title: Lucid CEO Peter Rawlinson steps down
items.summary:
- Peter Rawlinson, CEO of Lucid Group, steps down effective February 25.
- He will transition to a new role as a strategic technical adviser to the chairman.
- COO Marc Winterhoff will act as interim CEO during the search for a permanent replacement.
- Following the news, Lucid's stock increased by 9% in after-hours trading, reaching US$2.85.

items.title: UAE, S Korea partner for AI-powered farming in Abu Dhabi
items.summary:
- UAE's Pure Harvest Smart Farms and Korea's PlanTFarm launched a high-tech farming facility in Al Ain.
- The facility employs AI technologies for controlled environment agriculture (CEA) and reduces water use for animal fodder by 95%.
- The partnership, announced in December 2023, aims to enhance food security in the UAE using vertical farming and greenhouses.
